1.name: GPIO 40-pin
1.description: 40-pin GPIO header compatible with Raspberry Pi
1.details:
The ROCK 5B provides a 40-pin GPIO header that is compatible with Raspberry Pi. It includes GPIO, I2C, SPI, UART, PWM, and ADC functions.

Pinout:
- 3.3V, 5V power pins
- GPIO pins (up to 28 GPIOs available)
- I2C interfaces (I2C0, I2C1, I2C2)
- SPI interfaces (SPI0, SPI1)
- UART interfaces (UART0, UART1, UART2, UART3)
- PWM outputs
- ADC inputs (SARADC)

For detailed pin mapping, please refer to the GPIO pinout diagram in the documentation.

2.name: eMMC Socket
2.description: Onboard eMMC socket for storage expansion
2.details:
The ROCK 5B features an eMMC socket that supports eMMC 5.1 storage modules. This provides high-speed storage directly on the board.

Specifications:
- Supports eMMC 5.1 standard
- Transfer rates up to 400MB/s
- Available in various capacities (32GB, 64GB, 128GB)
- Bootable storage option

Note: The eMMC module is optional and can be purchased separately.

3.name: MIPI CSI CAM0
3.details:
MIPI CSI-2 interface for connecting camera modules. Supports high-speed video input.

Specifications:
- 4-lane MIPI CSI-2
- Supports up to 4K resolution
- Compatible with standard MIPI camera modules
- Data rate: up to 6Gbps

Used for connecting MIPI CSI camera modules for computer vision applications.

4.name: MIPI CSI CAM1
4.details:
Second MIPI CSI-2 interface for dual camera setups.

Specifications:
- 4-lane MIPI CSI-2
- Supports up to 4K resolution
- Can be used simultaneously with CAM0
- Ideal for stereo vision applications

Allows for dual camera configurations for 3D vision and depth sensing.

5.name: MIPI DSI
5.details:
MIPI DSI interface for connecting display panels.

Specifications:
- 4-lane MIPI DSI
- Supports up to 1080p resolution
- Compatible with MIPI DSI displays
- Touch panel support through I2C

Used for connecting LCD displays directly to the board without HDMI.

6.name: PCIe M.2 Key M
6.description: M.2 Key M slot for NVMe SSD
6.details:
PCIe M.2 Key M slot supporting NVMe SSDs for high-speed storage.

Specifications:
- PCIe 3.0 x4 interface
- Supports NVMe SSDs
- Up to 2TB capacity supported
- Transfer rates up to 4GB/s

Provides ultra-fast storage for the operating system and applications.

7.name: PCIe B Key
7.description: M.2 Key B slot for WiFi/Bluetooth modules
7.details:
M.2 Key B slot designed for WiFi and Bluetooth modules.

Specifications:
- PCIe 2.0 x1 or USB 2.0 interface
- Supports standard WiFi/BT modules
- Compatible with Intel and AMD WiFi cards
- Includes antenna connectors

Used for adding wireless connectivity to the board.

8.name: Gigabit Ethernet
8.details:
Gigabit Ethernet port for wired network connectivity.

Specifications:
- 10/100/1000 Mbps auto-negotiation
- RJ45 connector
- Supports Wake-on-LAN
- IPv4/IPv6 support

Provides reliable wired network connection for the board.

9.name: USB 3.0 Port 1
9.details:
High-speed USB 3.0 port for connecting peripherals.

Specifications:
- USB 3.0 SuperSpeed
- Data rate up to 5Gbps
- Backward compatible with USB 2.0/1.1
- Type-A connector

Can be used for external storage, cameras, and other high-speed devices.

10.name: USB 3.0 Port 2
10.details:
Second high-speed USB 3.0 port.

Specifications:
- USB 3.0 SuperSpeed
- Data rate up to 5Gbps
- Backward compatible with USB 2.0/1.1
- Type-A connector

Provides additional high-speed connectivity for peripherals.

11.name: USB 2.0 Port
11.details:
Standard USB 2.0 port for general peripherals.

Specifications:
- USB 2.0 High Speed
- Data rate up to 480Mbps
- Backward compatible with USB 1.1
- Type-A connector

Suitable for keyboards, mice, and other low-speed devices.

12.name: HDMI Output
12.details:
HDMI port for connecting external displays.

Specifications:
- HDMI 2.0
- Supports up to 4K@60Hz
- Audio output supported
- HDCP 2.2 compliant

Used for connecting monitors, TVs, and projectors.

13.name: DC Power Input
13.description: DC power jack for main power supply
13.details:
DC power input jack for supplying power to the board.

Specifications:
- Input voltage: 12V DC
- Minimum current: 3A
- Recommended power supply: 12V/5A
- Barrel connector: 5.5mm x 2.5mm

Provides main power to the ROCK 5B board.

14.name: Maskrom Button
14.details:
Maskrom button used for entering maskrom mode for firmware flashing and recovery.

Usage:
- Press and hold while powering on to enter maskrom mode
- Used for firmware recovery and flashing
- Required when updating bootloader
- Can be used with RKDevTool for firmware operations

Important: Only use when instructed for firmware updates.

15.name: LED Indicators
15.details:
LED indicators showing board status and activity.

LEDs included:
- Power LED: Indicates power is applied
- Activity LED: Shows system activity
- Network LED: Indicates network activity
- User LED: Programmable by user applications

These LEDs provide visual feedback about the board's operational status.
